description: Automatically runs go mod tidy when Go files or go.mod are modified to keep dependencies clean
author: JSONbored
features: Automatic go mod tidy execution for Go file and go.mod changes
Go vet integration for static analysis and error detection
Module dependency validation and inconsistency detection
Unused dependency cleanup and missing import resolution
Go workspace and multi-module project support
Dependency vulnerability scanning with go list
Module cache optimization and cleanup suggestions
Build constraint and Go version compatibility checking

configuration.scriptContent:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Read the tool input from stdin
INPUT=$(cat)
TOOL_NAME=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_name')
FILE_PATH=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r '.tool_input.file_path // .tool_input.path // ""')

if [ -z "$FILE_PATH" ]; then
  exit 0
fi

# Check if this is a Go-related file
if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.go ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *go.mod ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *go.sum ]] || [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *go.work* ]]; then
  echo "ðŸ”§ Go Module Maintenance for: $(basename "$FILE_PATH")" >&2
  
  # Find the Go module root
  MODULE_DIR="$(dirname "$FILE_PATH")"
  
  # Walk up the directory tree to find go.mod
  while [ "$MODULE_DIR" != "/" ] && [ ! -f "$MODULE_DIR/go.mod" ]; do
    MODULE_DIR="$(dirname "$MODULE_DIR")"
  done
  
  if [ ! -f "$MODULE_DIR/go.mod" ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸ No go.mod found - not a Go module" >&2
    exit 0
  fi
  
  echo "ðŸ“ Go module root: $MODULE_DIR" >&2
  cd "$MODULE_DIR"
  
  # Check if Go is installed
  if ! command -v go &> /dev/null; then
    echo "âŒ Go is not installed or not in PATH" >&2
    exit 1
  fi
  
  GO_VERSION=$(go version | cut -d' ' -f3 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
  echo "ðŸ¹ Go version: $GO_VERSION" >&2
  
  # Initialize maintenance counters
  ERRORS=0
  WARNINGS=0
  FIXED=0
  
  # Function to report issues
  report_issue() {
    local level="$1"
    local message="$2"
    
    case "$level" in
      "ERROR")
        echo "âŒ ERROR: $message" >&2
        ERRORS=$((ERRORS + 1))
        ;;
      "WARNING")
        echo "âš ï¸ WARNING: $message" >&2
        WARNINGS=$((WARNINGS + 1))
        ;;
      "FIXED")
        echo "âœ… FIXED: $message" >&2
        FIXED=$((FIXED + 1))
        ;;
      "INFO")
        echo "â„¹ï¸ INFO: $message" >&2
        ;;
    esac
  }
  
  # 1. Pre-tidy Module Analysis
  echo "ðŸ“Š Analyzing module state..." >&2
  
  # Check go.mod syntax
  if ! go mod edit -json > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    report_issue "ERROR" "go.mod has syntax errors"
    exit 1
  else
    echo "   âœ… go.mod syntax is valid" >&2
  fi
  
  # Get current dependencies before tidy
  DEPS_BEFORE=$(go list -m all 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs || echo "0")
  echo "   ðŸ“¦ Dependencies before tidy: $DEPS_BEFORE" >&2
  
  # Check for any build errors
  if go list ./... > /dev/null 2>&1; then
    echo "   âœ… Module builds successfully" >&2
  else
    report_issue "WARNING" "Module has build issues that may affect dependency resolution"
  fi
  
  # 2. Run go mod tidy
  echo "ðŸ§¹ Running go mod tidy..." >&2
  
  if go mod tidy; then
    report_issue "FIXED" "go mod tidy completed successfully"
    
    # Check dependencies after tidy
    DEPS_AFTER=$(go list -m all 2>/dev/null | wc -l | xargs || echo "0")
    DEPS_CHANGE=$((DEPS_AFTER - DEPS_BEFORE))
    
    if [ "$DEPS_CHANGE" -gt 0 ]; then
      echo "   ðŸ“ˆ Added $DEPS_CHANGE dependencies" >&2
    elif [ "$DEPS_CHANGE" -lt 0 ]; then
      echo "   ðŸ“‰ Removed $((DEPS_CHANGE * -1)) dependencies" >&2
    else
      echo "   ðŸ“¦ No dependency changes" >&2
    fi
    
  else
    report_issue "ERROR" "go mod tidy failed"
  fi
  
  # 3. Verify go.sum integrity
  echo "ðŸ” Verifying module checksums..." >&2
  
  if go mod verify; then
    echo "   âœ… All module checksums verified" >&2
  else
    report_issue "ERROR" "Module checksum verification failed"
  fi
  
  # 4. Check for vulnerabilities (if govulncheck is available)
  if command -v govulncheck &> /dev/null; then
    echo "ðŸ›¡ï¸ Scanning for vulnerabilities..." >&2
    
    if govulncheck ./... 2>/dev/null; then
      echo "   âœ… No known vulnerabilities found" >&2
    else
      report_issue "WARNING" "Potential vulnerabilities detected - run 'govulncheck ./...' for details"
    fi
  else
    echo "   ðŸ’¡ Install govulncheck for vulnerability scanning: go install golang.org/x/vuln/cmd/govulncheck@latest" >&2
  fi
  
  # 5. Run go vet for Go source files
  if [[ "$FILE_PATH" == *.go ]]; then
    echo "ðŸ” Running go vet..." >&2
    
    if go vet ./...; then
      echo "   âœ… go vet passed - no issues found" >&2
    else
      report_issue "WARNING" "go vet found potential issues"
    fi
    
    # Check for common Go issues
    echo "ðŸ” Additional Go code analysis..." >&2
    
    # Check for gofmt issues
    UNFORMATTED=$(find . -name '*.go' -not -path './vendor/*' -exec gofmt -l {} \; 2>/dev/null)
    if [ -n "$UNFORMATTED" ]; then
      report_issue "WARNING" "Some files are not gofmt formatted"
      echo "$UNFORMATTED" | head -5 | while read file; do
        echo "     $file" >&2
      done
    else
      echo "   âœ… All Go files are properly formatted" >&2
    fi
    
    # Check imports with goimports if available
    if command -v goimports &> /dev/null; then
      IMPORT_ISSUES=$(find . -name '*.go' -not -path './vendor/*' -exec goimports -l {} \; 2>/dev/null)
      if [ -n "$IMPORT_ISSUES" ]; then
        report_issue "WARNING" "Some files have import formatting issues"
      else
        echo "   âœ… All imports are properly formatted" >&2
      fi
    fi
  fi
  
  # 6. Module cleanup suggestions
  echo "ðŸ§¹ Module optimization check..." >&2
  
  # Check for indirect dependencies that could be direct
  INDIRECT_COUNT=$(go list -m all | grep -c '// indirect' || echo "0")
  if [ "$INDIRECT_COUNT" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "   ðŸ“Š Indirect dependencies: $INDIRECT_COUNT" >&2
    echo "   ðŸ’¡ Review if any indirect deps should be direct" >&2
  fi
  
  # Check for replace directives
  REPLACE_COUNT=$(grep -c '^replace ' go.mod 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
  if [ "$REPLACE_COUNT" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "   ðŸ”„ Replace directives: $REPLACE_COUNT" >&2
    echo "   ðŸ’¡ Review replace directives for production readiness" >&2
  fi
  
  # 7. Workspace support
  if [ -f "go.work" ]; then
    echo "ðŸ¢ Go workspace detected" >&2
    
    if go work sync; then
      echo "   âœ… Workspace synced successfully" >&2
    else
      report_issue "WARNING" "Workspace sync issues detected"
    fi
  fi
  
  # 8. Module cache suggestions
  if [ "$DEPS_AFTER" -gt 50 ]; then
    echo "ðŸ’¡ Large dependency count - consider 'go clean -modcache' if disk space is low" >&2
  fi
  
  # 9. Generate Summary Report
  echo "" >&2
  echo "ðŸ“‹ Go Module Maintenance Summary:" >&2
  echo "================================" >&2
  echo "   ðŸ“„ Module: $(basename "$(pwd)")" >&2
  echo "   ðŸ¹ Go: $GO_VERSION" >&2
  echo "   ðŸ“¦ Dependencies: $DEPS_AFTER" >&2
  echo "   âœ… Fixed: $FIXED" >&2
  echo "   âš ï¸ Warnings: $WARNINGS" >&2
  echo "   âŒ Errors: $ERRORS" >&2
  
  if [ "$ERRORS" -eq 0 ] && [ "$WARNINGS" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "   ðŸŽ‰ Status: EXCELLENT - Module is clean and optimized" >&2
  elif [ "$ERRORS" -eq 0 ]; then
    echo "   âœ… Status: GOOD - Minor warnings to review" >&2
  else
    echo "   âŒ Status: NEEDS ATTENTION - Errors require fixing" >&2
  fi
  
  echo "" >&2
  echo "ðŸ’¡ Go Module Best Practices:" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Run 'go mod tidy' regularly to keep dependencies clean" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Use 'go mod why <module>' to understand dependency reasons" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Update dependencies with 'go get -u ./...' carefully" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Consider using 'go mod graph' for dependency visualization" >&2
  echo "   â€¢ Pin important dependencies to specific versions" >&2
  
  # Exit with error if there are critical issues
  if [ "$ERRORS" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "âš ï¸ Go module maintenance completed with errors" >&2
    exit 1
  fi
  
else
  # Not a Go file, exit silently
  exit 0
fi

exit 0

useCases: Automated Go dependency management in development workflows
Go module cleanup and optimization in CI/CD pipelines
Go codebase quality assurance with integrated static analysis
